header.note: We are in the process of moving strings from Bloom.xlf to BloomMediumPriority.xlf and BloomLowPriority.xlf while trying very hard to preserve translations and approval status.

trans-unit.source: Clicking this validates the positions things have been dragged to.

trans-unit.note: Label of a button that puts the Bloom Game tool into its the mode for adding elements that should show when the reader gets the answer right.

trans-unit.source: Add items that will show when the learner gets the correct answer. For example, you might add a text that says “Correct!” with a GIF of a dancing chicken.
Place the letters anywhere on the scene, in a mixed up order.
Place the images anywhere on the scene, and the targets where the student should put them.
Place the targets in the places needed for the correct answer.

trans-unit.note: This is the label of an item that can be dragged onto the canvas to hold text, typically a single letter. It works best if it is one of the widest letters (including digraphs) in your alphabet
Used as the label of a button that is otherwise the name of a sound file, indicating that no sound has been chosen.

trans-unit.source: Type a sentence. Bloom will shuffle the words for the student to fix.
Put the Order Circles in the correct order. Bloom will shuffle them when it is time to play.
Untick this item if it is not part of the right answer

trans-unit.note: Label of a button that puts the Bloom Game tool into its the mode for playing (testing) the game.
Used as the label of a button that is otherwise the name of a sound file, indicating that no sound has been chosen.

trans-unit.source: Keep all items and targets the same size
Type a sentence. The reader will be asked to sort the words.

trans-unit.note: Label of a button that puts the Bloom Game tool into its initial mode for setting up the game.

trans-unit.source: Text to put on the page

trans-unit.note: This is the label of an item that can be dragged onto the canvas to hold text, typically about the length of a word.
Label of a button that puts the Bloom Game tool into its the mode for adding elements that should show when the reader gets the answer wrong.

trans-unit.source: Add items that will show when the learner gets the wrong answer. For example, you might add a text that says “Try Again!”.\nIt is OK to have no correct or wrong answers. Just give the same positive reinforcement, like “Looks Nice!”.

trans-unit.note: This text is shown if an error occurred while running eSpeak. eSpeak is a piece of software that this program uses to do text-to-speech (have the computer read text out loud).

trans-unit.source: Please split or clear the existing recording in this text box before changing modes.
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool, enable "Record the whole text box...", make a recording, and then attempt to uncheck the "Record the whole text box..." input (without first clearing the audio recordings you are about to lose)
For "split", please use same terminology as in ID: EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.SplitLabel
For "clear", please use same terminology as in ID: EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.Clear
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: If you import this recording, it will replace all the audio for this text box.

trans-unit.note: A segment marker is just "|" and it is used to break a sentence up into smaller sections for highlighting in sync with the audio.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

A timings file is either from Audacity or generated by Bloom. It contains one line for each segment of the text. The line contains the start and stop time of the audio that should be synchronized with that text segment.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Click this to insert a "|" character into the text at the current cursor position. This character tells Bloom to introduce a new segment for the purpose of highlighting the text during audio playback. You can also just type the "|" character using your keyboard.
Bloom will hide these when you publish.
trans-unit.note: This will be appended to the end of EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.InsertSegmentMarkerTip. "these" refers to the "|" characters that mark audio segments, described in EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.InsertSegmentMarkerTip

trans-unit.source: First, put the cursor in a box which has something to record.
trans-unit.note: This is shown on a button that only makes sense if the cursor is in a box of text.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change this mode, first use the "Clear" button to remove your recording.
Record one sentence at a time. You can break up sentences using the `|` character.
Record the whole text box in one take, or load in a recording.
Import an mp3 recording of the whole text box.
This is disabled because this box is not in `Record by Text Box` mode.
Open the timing file in a text editor. After you save your changes, click the "Apply Timings File" button.
This is only enabled after doing a "Split" of a recording of the whole text box.

This lets you choose a file containing timings for aligning the audio with the text. The format of the file is tab-separated values, with the first column being the start time in seconds, and the second column being the end time in seconds. The third column is often a label, but it will be ignored.
Control the order in which various boxes on the page are played back.

trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection
Image descriptions are typed out, then recorded, so that the book can be used by the blind. This is a switch that shows the typed out image descriptions next to each image on the page.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection
Used in the Key hints at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for Alt+drag and Ctrl+drag.
Used in the Key hint at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for "Alt + drag = resize".
Used in the Key hint at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for "Ctrl + drag = move".

trans-unit.source: Select this if you want readers to be able to choose to read the book in this language.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether this language will be included in the published book.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this language is currently shown in the book, so it is required.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether this language will be included in the published book. In this case, the user is not allowed to change the value.

trans-unit.source: Select this if you want to include this audio.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether the Talking Book audio for this language will be included in the published book.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this book does not have any audio in this language.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether the Talking Book audio for this language will be included in the published book. In this case, the user is not allowed to change the value.

trans-unit.source: This book does not have any interactive activities.
This is disabled because publishing interactive activities is a Bloom Enterprise feature.
This is disabled because this book does not have any overlay elements that qualify as “comic-like”, such as speech bubbles.
Select this if you want to list this book as a Comic Book. This only affects how the book is categorized, it does not affect the content of the book.
This is disabled because this book does not have any pages with motion enabled.
Select this if you want to show motion when the book is read in landscape mode.
This is disabled because this book does not have any videos.
The videos in this book contain {N}
trans-unit.note: {N} will be replaced with a link whose text is the name of the (sign) language and which opens a chooser

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this collection has {no sign language selected}.
trans-unit.note: The result should have a section in braces. This will become a hot link which will open a user interface that lets the user select a sign language.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this book does not have any Talking Book recordings.
This is disabled because no “Talking Book Languages” are selected.
This is disabled because this book does not have any image descriptions in the primary language.
Select this if you want to list this book as accessible to the visually impaired in the primary language. This only affects how the book is categorized, it does not affect the content of the book.
Do not show this book to the public yet. I will share its URL with reviewers for feedback.
Consider whether you can distribute your book using the BloomPUB format instead of, or in addition to, the ePUB format.
[Some Bloom features] are not supported by most or all ePUB readers.
trans-unit.note: The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: Most ePUB readers are very low quality ([see our research and recommendations]).
trans-unit.note: The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.
"Linux" is an operating system name which may not translate.

trans-unit.source: This feature is available only on the Windows version of Bloom. We apologize for the inconvenience.
trans-unit.note: "Windows" and "Linux" are operating system names which may not translate.

trans-unit.source: Why you should publish on the Web
trans-unit.note: This phrase has a link to an explanation of the benefits of sharing books on BloomLibrary.org.
This phrase has a link to bring up the help viewer on the topic "Publish to Web".
This phrase has a link to the "About Bloom" page on that website.
{0} is the name of a Branding pack
{0} is the name of a Branding pack
{0} is the name of an xmatter pack
keyword used to describe the size in pixels of a display screen or of an image
label for our small resolution (600 x 600)
abbreviation for Full High Definition (1920 x 1080)
abbreviation for Ultra High Definition, also known as "4K" (3480 x 2160)

trans-unit.source: Bloom reduces images to a maximum size to make books easier to view over poor internet connections and take up less space on phones.
trans-unit.note: displayed below the slider that is used to set the image resolution

trans-unit.source: Languages to show in normal text boxes
Page Themes are a bundle of margins, borders, and other page settings. For information about each theme, see [Page Themes Catalog](https://docs.bloomlibrary.org/page-themes-catalog).
Normally, books use the front & back matter pack that is chosen for the entire collection. Using this setting, you can cause this individual book to use a different one.

trans-unit.note: This term tries to briefly describe the native size of the picture in pixel dimensions.
{0} is a placeholder for a filename and should not be translated

trans-unit.source: The {0} stylesheet of this book is incompatible with modern themes. Bloom is using it because the book is using the Legacy-5-6 theme. Click [here] for more information.
trans-unit.note: {0} is a placeholder for a filename. The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: Bloom found a known version of {0} in this book and replaced it with a modern theme. You can delete it unless you still need to publish the book from an earlier version of Bloom.
trans-unit.note: {0} is a placeholder for a filename.

trans-unit.source: The {0} stylesheet of this book is incompatible with modern themes. Bloom is currently ignoring it. If you don't need those customizations any more, you can delete your {0}. Click [here] for more information.
trans-unit.note: {0} is a placeholder for a filename. (Note that it appears twice.) The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: The {0} stylesheet of this book is incompatible with modern themes. Bloom is currently ignoring it. Click [here] for more information.
trans-unit.note: {0} is a placeholder for a filename. The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: The selected page theme does not support the following settings.
Smart spacing around text boxes. Works well for simple pages, but may not suit custom layouts.
When you publish a book to the web or as an ebook, Bloom will flag any problematic fonts. For example, we cannot legally host most Microsoft fonts on BloomLibrary.org.
The following table shows where fonts have been used.

trans-unit.note: flags that the same font is used for all languages for the given style
Do not change {0}. It will be replaced by the page number.
